statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: American 80, Mt. St. Marys 60
article.story: WASHINGTON (AP) -- Brayden Billbe scored five of his career-high 19 points in the final minutes and American never trailed en route to its first win of the season, 80-60 over Mount St. Mary's. Andre Ingram scored 13 and Arvydas Eitutavicius and Travis Lay each added 11 for the Eagles (1-6), who outrebounded the Mount 36-24 in American's first home game of the season. Mychal Cook led the Mount (1-5) with 13 points off the bench, keeping his team close in the first half, but scoring only a late basket in the second. American took control with an 18-2 run in the second half, keyed by back-to-back 3-pointers from Eitutavicius and Garrison Carr, to take a 57-40 lead. The Mount answered with a 10-0 spurt, including 6-of-6 foul shooting from Mychal Kearse, but never got closer then seven. Billbe helped the Eagles pull away with an inside basket and a three-point play, stretching the American lead to 20 before fouling out with 1:05 to play. American opened the game on an 11-0 run. The Mount responded to tie it twice, first at 26-all on Cook's 3-pointer from the right elbow, and then at 31 on Chris Vann's layup. ^
